indexes.update_statistics: UPDATE STATISTICS FOR `shellTest`(ALL ARRAY (ALL ARRAY `b` FOR b IN object_values((`a`.`o`)) END) FOR a IN `a1` END, `c1`, `c2`)

statements: advise SELECT a.c1, u111 FROM shellTest AS a UNNEST a.a1 AS u1 UNNEST u1.a11 AS u11 UNNEST u11.a111 AS u111 WHERE a.o1.id = 'abc' AND u111.name = 'xyz'

indexes.index_statement: CREATE INDEX adv_ALL_a1_a11_a111_name_o1_id ON `shellTest`(ALL ARRAY (ALL ARRAY (ALL ARRAY `u111`.`name` FOR u111 IN `u11`.`a111` END) FOR u11 IN `u1`.`a11` END) FOR u1 IN `a1` END,`o1`.`id`)
indexes.recommending_rule: Index keys follow order of predicate types: 1. leading array index for unnest, 2. equality/null/missing.

results.query: SELECT a.c1, u111 FROM shellTest AS a UNNEST a.a1 AS u1 UNNEST u1.a11 AS u11 UNNEST u11.a111 AS u111 WHERE a.o1.id = 'abc' AND u111.name = 'xyz'

statements: advise SELECT * FROM shellTest WHERE (c1 = false OR c1 IS MISSING) AND ANY v IN a1 SATISFIES v = 11 END ORDER BY c3

indexes.index_statement: CREATE INDEX adv_DISTINCT_a1_c1 ON `shellTest`(DISTINCT ARRAY `v` FOR `v` IN `a1` END,`c1`)
indexes.update_statistics: UPDATE STATISTICS FOR `shellTest`(DISTINCT ARRAY `v` FOR `v` IN `a1` END, `c1`)

results.query: SELECT * FROM shellTest WHERE (c1 = false OR c1 IS MISSING) AND ANY v IN a1 SATISFIES v = 11 END ORDER BY c3

statements: advise SELECT COUNT(s.c1) AS num FROM shellTest AS s UNNEST a1 AS us WHERE us.type = 'x1'

covering_indexes.index_statement: CREATE INDEX adv_ALL_a1_type_c1 ON `shellTest`(ALL ARRAY `us`.`type` FOR us IN `a1` END,`c1`)

results.query: SELECT COUNT(s.c1) AS num FROM shellTest AS s UNNEST a1 AS us WHERE us.type = 'x1'

testcase: MB-63577 part-1 disjunction with 1st predicate as a function call and IS MISSING as 2nd predicate on the same key
statements: ADVISE SELECT meta().id FROM shellTest WHERE type = "right" AND  (REGEXP_CONTAINS (c21, "^[0-9;]*$") OR  c21 IS MISSING)

results.query: SELECT meta().id FROM shellTest WHERE type = "right" AND  (REGEXP_CONTAINS (c21, "^[0-9;]*$") OR  c21 IS MISSING);

testcase: MB-63577 part-2 disjunction with 1st predicate as a function call, 2nd as predicate IS MISSING, 3rd as IS NULL on the same key
statements: ADVISE SELECT meta().id FROM shellTest WHERE type = "right" AND  (REGEXP_CONTAINS (c21, "^[0-9;]*$") OR  c21 IS MISSING OR c21 IS NULL)

results.query: SELECT meta().id FROM shellTest WHERE type = "right" AND (REGEXP_CONTAINS (c21, "^[0-9;]*$") OR c21 IS NULL OR c21 IS MISSING);

testcase: MB-63577 part-3 disjunction with 1st predicate as a function call, 2nd as IS NULL, 3rd as IS MISSING on the same key
statements: ADVISE SELECT meta().id FROM shellTest WHERE type = "right" AND (REGEXP_CONTAINS (c21, "^[0-9;]*$") OR c21 IS NULL OR c21 IS MISSING)
